formattedAddress: 263 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 263 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: This place is amazing. I love there service and there qualities , Best quality and best service. I will always keep coming. and let me not forget the prices are super great comparison to the garment district.

text.text: This place is amazing. I love there service and there qualities , Best quality and best service. I will always keep coming. and let me not forget the prices are super great comparison to the garment district.

originalText.text: It's a nice and big store. I was happy with the selection and I found what I wanted. The prices weren't posted and I had to negotiate. I don't mind negotiating, but it makes me feel taken advantage of sometimes since I don't know that much about fabric. I walked out with enough fabric for a giant tablecloth and the price seemed ok. The staff was helpful, but don't forget to negotiate because they took 25% off their original verbal price when I asked although some other fabrics might be more or less flexible on the price.

originalText.text: Been going here for over 10 years now. Love Fred and Anna! They keep up with all of the new fabrics and appliquÃ©s.

originalText.text:
The other day I visited this store in hopes of locating a particular fabric. I looked at fabric for a while with no assistance when the Indian looking lady approached me with an attitude and shouted that she was going to help me. She was clearly being obnoxious because I was unraveling fabric. I told her to watch her tone. Needless to say, I never got any help. ðŸ¤£ The store always has a weird smell and the fabric is exceptionally over priced.  There are several
Others on the same block. Skip this one if possible

originalText.text:
While in the store, I ordered 100 yards of a particular fabric for my business.  They were to ship it to me. Weeks went by. When I called to see where it was they said it could not be delivered and was on the truck back to them. ?!? I receive shipments all the time.  Then they shipped me the wrong fabric (a lesser quality fabric).  I then had to spend a month working with their sister store, Diana Fabrics, to try to get it replaced, because the staff at Exclusive Fabrics would not answer their phone.  After several attempts getting them to send me the return postage and shipping label, I finally sent it back.  They said they didn't have the fabric I wanted, there are no refunds, so I could just select something else. Diana told me that her secretary would send me a catalog.  That took two weeks, because when I called and spoke with the secretary, she didn't know anything about it.    This is now about half a year later. I didn't want anything else. I specifically ordered that fabric. Two months later, when someone actually answered the phone at Exclusive Fabrics, I was able to get an employee to send me twenty yards of what I ordered and another 27 of the same fabric (only different color).  He even apologized to me saying, "I'm just trying to make a penny for the boss" .
What does that mean?!
Yay!  A year and a half later, I finally have half of what I paid for.  It's been three months since then. I've called, left messages and no one returns my calls.

Don't walk out of the store without your merchandise!  You won't get it!
